intro: Hedlundia teodori, commonly known as the Teodor's hedlundia, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical or subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
